DOC.TEXT: Here are the major business events and economic events scheduled for the coming week (some dates are tentative; times are EST):
New Year's Day, government, banks, financial markets and most businesses are closed.

DETROIT _ Domestic automakers report mid-December sales. WASHINGTON _ Commerce Department reports construction spending for November, 10 a.m. WASHINGTON _ Treasury reports results of three-month and six-month auctions, 4 p.m.

WASHINGTON _ Commerce Department reports new home sales for November, 10 a.m. CINCINNATI _ Cincinnati Bell's defamation lawsuit over the wiretapping allegations by former employees resumes. HOWEY IN THE HILLS, Fla. _ Agriculture ministers-secretaries for European Economic Community, Canada, Japan, Australia and United States confer on mutual problems-issues, through Friday.

UNDATED _ Major general retailers report their sales for December. DETROIT _ Automakers report sales for all of December and the full calendar year. LOS ANGELES _ Sentencing hearing for Mobil Oil Corp. after pleading no contest to misdemeanor charges stemming from two pipeline ruptures that poured crude oil into river and sewers.

WASHINGTON _ Commerce Department reports factory orders for December, 10 a.m. WASHINGTON _ Labor Department reports unemployment for December, 10:30 a.m. BALTIMORE _ Sentencing for FDA chemist David Brancato for his part in generic drug bribery scam.
